Any intercurrent pathology (vomiting, diarrhoea, infection, fracture, myocardial infarction, surgery, anaesthesia, invasive diagnostic procedure, major physical effort, intense psychological stress, etc.) is a cause of decompensation of treated adrenal insufficiency.

And the patient's failure to adapt hydrocortisone treatment sufficiently to these situations: Importance of therapeutic education in adrenal insufficiency.

question.title: What can cause decompensation of treated adrenal insufficiency?
question.description: A patient with adrenal insufficiency may experience decompensation due to

option_a.title: Ignoring hydrocortisone treatment
option_a.description: The patient's failure to take hydrocortisone as prescribed

option_b.title: Major physical effort
option_b.description: Engaging in strenuous physical activity without adjusting hydrocortisone dosage

option_c.title: Hydrocortisone overdose
option_c.description: Taking too much hydrocortisone, which can lead to decompensation

option_d.title: Infection or surgery
option_d.description: Any intercurrent pathology, including infections or surgeries, can cause decompensation
